alert.note: Alert for Bureau; Putnam (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 07 at 8:33PM CDT until May 08 at 2:45AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in Quad Cities has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Bureau County in north central Illinois... Northeastern Putnam County in north central Illinois... * Until 245 AM CDT Monday. * At 833 PM CDT, local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. At 830 PM, law enforcement reported water over several highways south of La Moille and Ohio. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Princeton, Hennepin, Spring Valley, DePue, Walnut, Ladd, La Moille, Dalzell, Ohio, Cherry, Malden, Seatonville, Arlington, Dover, Hollowayville, Zearing, Coal Hollow, Van Orin, Kasbeer and Ottville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 180 between mile markers 8 and 13. Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 54 and 72. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
